data.text:
So what happens when we graduate? Friday morning I left for New Brunswick via Air Canada, as usual, arrived in Moncton meeting Jaime to drive me to Sackville. We checked in and frankly I went right to bed.

The following day we went shopping and then we prepared for our Senior Prom, which no doubt would be scandalously more fun than my original high school Prom of 2004. Although I was the Prom King that year, I had hell of a lot more fun at this one. The above photo reflects the old me, looking formal and sun-liten. Thatâ€™s the flashback, back to reality nowâ€¦

We were getting reading whilst staying in Edwards House, and I had a little too much to drink, I suppose; we headed over to Hestler Hall. I met up with some people I havenâ€™t seen for a month, and would no doubt ever see again, and we danced the night away. I met up with Rosheen, Britney, Molly, and Alyson, sans Andrea who already moved to Banff, and hit the floor baby. As you can see, I certainly can bust a move, but yaâ€™ll ainâ€™t seen nothing yet.

After walking around in a drunken haze, I found Amber, my true lover from Ottawa. We spent the year in Strasbourg together, doing scandelous things, and since she was doing her thesis this year she was so busy and we rarely got to see each other. We managed to squeeze in a dance or two before the amazing DJ upstairs shut down and we headed downstairs to the sketchy pub.

The next day we decided to go to Joeyâ€™s for a celebratory dinner with Jaime, and Dorothy. We got a little hyper, and they had some sangrias while I pretended to be drinking, with water which was decked out with the garnishes of alcoholic beverages. All of this was leading up to Monday graduation where we would sit for hours and hours and listen to names.

I managed to find Natalie Monday Morning, my lover from French classes, and we hung out and caught up on what we were doing and took some photos. Although I didnâ€™t take many photos at grad, since the camera failed and mother and Sharon were unable to function it correctly, I managed to squeeze away from the awkwardness of photos and get my diploma framed, and who did I see there, but Natalie, who begged me for a photo. Luckily it turned out, and we are all hot.

The following day we departed for Shediac where I had lobster for the first time in my life, as it is the lobster capital of the worldâ€¦ who knew? Anyways, we headed home Tuesday morning in a haze of 16 hour car ride, with the boring scenery of Canada in the spring. We nearly crashed in MontrÃ©al, but made it to sketchy Cornwall for food, and then home for the evening.

A few comments before I comment on a dissapointing Eurovision-result final evening. This is the first time in 3 years that I havenâ€™t been able to watch any of the shows live, first because my internet service provider, Bell Sympatico, not only puts caps on itâ€™s downloading, but also because there is something wrong with our phone line so it always interuppts the feeds. I could only watch 10 seconds at a time before it disconnected and started over; I was flabbergasted.

But anyways; on to the show!

Romania â€“ Nico and Vlad

This song is well sung but Iâ€™m a bit disturbed about a few things. The singers are good, and they are decently looking, but Nico is wearing a suit with jeans on! Itâ€™s last yearâ€™s Latvia all over again, and since Iâ€™m the fashion police I can not permit such an attrocity to occur!

United Kingdom â€“ Andy Abraham

Major flop. Flop to the max even. This song is so horrible it annoys me. Terry Wogan continues to support his British people, year after year, but year after year they do poorly and itâ€™s not surprising. Instead of keeping your head up your ass, actually be honest about your entry and not so nationalistic and maybe you wonâ€™t be criticised so much. Message to the UK: go home until you come up with a good song, thatâ€™s like 5 flops in a row now!

Albania â€“ Olta Boka

Still struggling to understand why this is in the final; she keeps her eyes closed too much and it bothers me. Also the heart in the background screen makes my bitter soul and heart twich with disgruntled convultions; why oh why?

Germany â€“ No Angels

â— Personal Favourite

Okay I have to explain why I like this. The song itself is good, but the performance was horrible. The singing is so off, and only the blonde one can actaully carry a tune. The harmonies make me cringe, and it would be so much better if it was done solo or in a duet with actual singers. Apart from that, itâ€™s not a surprise that they got 12 points from Bulgaria, as one of them is Bulgarian. Who knew, right?

Armenia â€“ Sirusho

â— Personal Favourite

Huston, we have technical difficulties with earpeice. Despite this problem, it was a good performance and even better than the semifinal. I donâ€™t like her hair so poofy, but itâ€™s okay since I love the song and find the eastern feel very catchy. Qule, qule anytime Armenia. A fourth place finnish is very good, although I would have bumped you to third!

Bosnia & Herzegovina â€“ Laka

A lot of people find this song interseting, but I find it a tad cheesy and uninteresting. The song is quick, slow, and everything inbetween but the cheesy dancing and uninterested lead singer just takse all the energy away from the song, and country. Itâ€™s so much better when we have the empathetic ballads from the balkan countries, but alas things must change!

Israel â€“ Boaz

Huge surprise for me that this song qualified, as I think that the outfit of Boaz should have been shot in the semfiinal; however heâ€™s a good singer, so I guess I can permit Israel to participate, or something. Thankfully this didnâ€™t come in the top 5, but I still donâ€™t believe that itâ€™s top 10 material!

Finland â€“ TerÃ¤sbetoni

What a surprise eh? I suppose that there werenâ€™t many choices for the rockers in Europe, but this one was decent. Finland, also to the shegrin of the Swedes, nearly squeaked out the victory ahead of them, but thankflly to Malta Sweden came out on top! Let the men rock on, or something!

Croatia â€“ Kraljevi Ulice and 75 cents

Old men from Croatia scare me, comments from previous review standâ€¦

Poland â€“ Isis Gee

Fakest tan ever! I tried so hard to turn my head away during this song because I wasnâ€™t sure what to think. My eyes say YES OMG THE DRESS, and then they say EUWWW THE TAN! This woman is apparently American, but her English singing is so horrible that the words of her song arenâ€™t even audible. Maybe sheâ€™s unedcuated, or something? But her voice is pretty, so itâ€™s okay!

Iceland â€“ Euroband

â— Personal Favourite

This song will garner itâ€™s own personal review in the coming days because I love it so much. It made the top 15, which is fabulous for the island nation! Iceland, Iceland, Iceland. Atlhough my friend HeiÃ°ar would be disgusted, Iâ€™m so proud of his people and this song!

Turkey â€“ Mor ve Ã–tesi

I find myself becoming more and more attracted to the eastern feel of this rock song, and the Ã¦sthetics of the singer who is just plain.. Turkish! Itâ€™s a good song that I enjoy, but it doesnâ€™t make me want to get up and jump, which makes it lose some points chez moi!

Portugal â€“ VÃ¢nia Fernandes

Did VÃ¢nia gain some weight since Thursday? I donâ€™t know, Iâ€™m just kidding. I still donâ€™t get this song, and I will never get Portugal. Some day when the sexually-repressed latino country reforms its systems I will be able to understand it better. But until then, sianora sucker!

Latvia â€“ Pirates of the Sea

â— Personal Favourite

This performance was better, even though the lead singer fluffed the bridge key-change area. Itâ€™s okay, the pirate with more eye-liner on than I wear in a week is allowed to make a few changes. I have further comments though. The lead woman singer has so much cleavage I think it could rival the waves that sufers ride, and then her lip-gloss is so intense that it makes me wonder if she was the whore on board of the ships of pirates that they would just all sleep with. Sorry, that was a random tangent, but alas.. Whoohoo top 15!

Sweden â€“ Charlotte Perrelli

â— Personal Favourite

What a huge dissapointment for Charlotte, who gave it her all and was just dissapointed with the results. She didnâ€™t do anything wrong, just the voting didnâ€™t go her way. Iâ€™ve read some reports that claim that Swedenâ€™s choices might be getting more and more dated, but I stand by the schlagger ways and hope that that future will bring better results. Maybe next year we will win, and I will be able to go to Globen the subsequent year? ðŸ˜‰

Denmark â€“ Simon Mathew

This song still bothers me, but I wouldnâ€™t not give him the time of day. I just think that it didnâ€™t deserve all the votes that it got; casue there is much better that we can vote for, like ICELAND!

Georgia â€“ Diana Gurtskaya

I still donâ€™t get this, and it still managed to make top-12. What is going on, the song just flys under my radar and I barely remember anything other than sunglasses!

Ukraine â€“ Ani Lorak

=> Runner-Up

â— Personal Favourite

This song was sooo deserving to win, and it damn well should have. Ukranie really has been doing well and have chosen a good variety of songs in the last 5 years, with most of them doing well well. This song, is just plain sexy, well sung, great dancing, just a whole package performance of a small little girl with an enormously powerful voice! It pains me that the competition will be in Russia next year, and not Kiev!

France â€“ SÃ©bastien Tellier

Wow, of the big four countries, France is the only one making a little bit of effort to do better, and actually seeing results. This is not a bad song at all, despite the sketchy appearance of SÃ©bastien. The result is dissapointing, but still better than its been doing in the past; fÃ©licitations France!

Azerbaijan â€“ Elnur and Samir

â— Personal Favourite

Top 10 finish for the dÃ©but country with their angel, and devil combination with absolutely amazing voices. They are just so entertaining, but I think that the whole show had a little too much â€œumphâ€ (something I though I would never say, afterall!)

Greece â€“ Kalomira

I am still left lost for words from this song. Everyone has been ranting and raving about it, but I just donâ€™t get it. I find the dancing horrible, the singing nothing special, and the whole presentation just annoying. This comes in third, when better countries came later back; I just donâ€™t understand what everyone else sees.

Spain â€“ Rodolfo Chikilicuatre

This annoys me; go home. Youâ€™re even creepier looking than I imagined. In my opinion this is a huge goose-egg!

Serbia â€“ Jelena TomaÂševiÄ‡ feat. Bora DugiÄ‡

â— Personal Favourite

What a fantastic song! Itâ€™s strong, powerful, and filled with the Slavic Ballad feeling that we know so well and love. It has a great result as a host country, and even got votes from around Europe, and not just itâ€™s Slavic brothers and sisters! Iâ€™m really quite happy with this entry, and it was quite an honour to hear.

Russia â€“ Dima Bilan

=> Winner

This is the hugest dissapointment of the entire competition. I am not happy with this result, as I find Dima Biland incredibly annoying and a poor singer. Not only that itâ€™s horribly cheesy with Evgeni Plushenko, figure skater being a person to promote and skate in the show. I just donâ€™t like this song at all, as his previous song was better and had been more of a chance to win. I hate the fact that itâ€™s going to Russia next year, and bothers me even more that he runs around naked and jumps around and has really poor English. At lest now the Russians can shut the fuck up about never winning, and we wonâ€™t go back there for another few decades, I can only hope!

Norway â€“ Maria Haukaas Storeng

â— Personal Favourite

This is a great song, simple, and good vocals. She wears her clothings well, and she sings to the audience with great perfessionalism. Itâ€™s not by any means a surprise that Norway came in 5th place, even though I would have put it behind Sweden (of course).

So as you can gather from my Russian review, Iâ€™m very dissapointed with the results of this competition. The voting seemed bias as always, and I can only hope that the former Soviet republcis and Eastern European countries can come away from their trends of voting for the mother land. But at least they finally won, and can now shut up about it. Just sadly next year I will have to see his face again, as they will probably make him one of the hosts. If thatâ€™s the case he has a lot of English to learn first!

Tonightâ€™s semifinal was absolutely amazing. I didnâ€™t think that it would be so good, but I have to say that the first 4 songs are so amazing that it left me speechless. Not only that, but it was very entertaining in general, which makes it all the more interesting to watch and want to vote!

Iceland â€“ Euroband

=> Qualifier

â— Personal Favourite

I am left speechless, simply speechless. Iceland has got it together, and after their seemingly million semifinals they managed to get a song, not only that is good, but that Europe votes through to the final. Iâ€™m in love. I love pink, I love the singers, I love the song, and itâ€™s just fabulous. I need to find the pink shoes because they are so hawt, but also I want all of their outfits. I sing this song on my way to work; no jokes! I so want to be Icelandic right now, my god!

Sweden â€“ Charlotte Perrelli

=> Qualifier

â— Personal Favourite

Toppat i silver; frankly. Itâ€™s a former winner back to try to claim the title. After the absolutely amazing win in this yearâ€™s Melodifestivalen, Charlotte took the stage as a favourite and came through. Iâ€™m so glad that there are some schlagger songs left and that make me so happy and feel like I want to belt. The singing was decent, but not as good in the Swedish final, but they managed to make it look good on stage. My only concern is that sheâ€™s still looking like a little bit of an ogre on stage; but still hawt.

Turkey â€“ Mor ve Ã–tesi

=> Qualfier

Well I canâ€™t help but say that this rockish type song is actually pretty decent. Itâ€™s not filled with sketchy Turkish people also; which makes it a major plus! The guy is actually half decent looking, and can actually sing, which makes it all endurable. Itâ€™s not surprising that he made it through either, with all the Turkish diaspora of course; but this one actually deserved it unlike other stuff in the past.

Ukraine â€“ Ani Lorak

=> Qualifier

â— Personal Favourite

This songâ€¦ is â€¦ so â€¦ hot â€¦ I think I just got myself all wet from this performance. It has absolutely everything, and this is so clearly the favourite to win the competition, in my humble opinion. The song is catchy, well sung, absolutely huge hit, the dancing is complex and entertaining, and itâ€™s just plain sexy. Sheâ€™s gorgeous, sheâ€™s wearing a similar dress to Charlotte, but pulls it offer better, has steeper and hawter shoes; and a dance troop that is better than Swedenâ€™s. This is some tough competition, and this damn well better win, so help me schlagger.

Lithuania â€“ Jeronimas Milius

Where did this guy come fromâ€¦ seriously? He looks a bit scary, and sings better than in the video (sorta), but the song is so heinously awkward no wonder he was the only one on stage. Where did Lithuania go wrong here, because this is heinous. Although it is better, like I said, he actually is a horrible singer, and itâ€™s no doubt that it crashed and burned on stage. Oh well, itâ€™s still not bad enough to make me give it a â€œgo homeâ€ rating.

Albania â€“ Olta Boka

=> Qualifier

Why did people vote for this? I fail to see anything exciting or important about this entry. Olta has her eyes closed for most of the song, and I have no idea whatâ€™s going on. Her voice is pleasant and sweet, but I just donâ€™t understand. Europe, where did we all go wrong?

Switzerland â€“ Paolo Meneguzzi

â— Personal Favourite

This is by far the hugest upset of the entire competition. The song is so endearing, fun, and well sung. On top of that, weâ€™ve got an Italian-Swiss singer whoâ€™s actually decent, and the country put some effort to send a good song; and Europe rejects it for shit other songs like Croatia, and Albania? I donâ€™t understand. I just want to run up to him, give him a huge hug and kiss and say â€œCiaoâ€ and apologies for everyone elseâ€™s stupidity. Vote for the music, bitches, cause youâ€™re pissing me off more than anything! Iâ€™m so in shock, and I feel heartbroken because No era stupendoâ€¦

Czech Republic â€“ Tereza KerndlovÃ¡

Hmmm. This song is dated, like seriously. However, huge improvement from their dÃ©but year, I must say. The skanky dancers wearing basically nothing dancing around the stage is annoying, and also the DJ whoâ€™s singing out of key. You can tell they put a lot of effort in, cause there were pyrotechnics, but usually thatâ€™s just the wannabes doing anything that they can to get some votes. Keep up the improvement you crazy Czechs, and youâ€™ll do better, I promise!

Belarus â€“ Ruslan Alekhno

What the hell was this? I donâ€™t understand what is on stage, and this guy is hideously ugly. Iâ€™m trying not to seem too superficial, but this is absolutely horrendous! Save me, please! Go home Belarus, and donâ€™t come back until you have a decent song, golly!

Latvia â€“ Pirates of the Sea

=> Qualifier

â— Personal Favourite

Disturbingly catchy, and heinously cheesy, Latvia jumps the plank with a sketchy entry and actually qualifies in the top 10! Clearly an Aqua, Latvian rip-off, the childrenâ€™s song is quite entertaining despite the horrible dancing and sketchy singing of some of the backup singers. I have to say that Iâ€™ve never seen so much lip-gloss on a pirate before, and the main singer wears more eye-liner than me, and thatâ€™s disturbing!

Croatia â€“ Kraljevi Ulice and 75 cents

=> Qualifier

I keep getting the impression that Croatia only has old people in their country, because year after year they send the dinosaur singers to compete, and oddly they do well. What is with that, when the largest upsets of the competition make it through, and then weird shit like this gets past the public. This year we canâ€™t blame regional voting, but secretly in my mind I will, just because Iâ€™m bitter. Go home to Zagreb, and come back with at least Slavic ballad, next year!

Bulgaria â€“ Deep Zone and Balthazar

What a lovely dress she has on, but it just doesnâ€™t cut it despite the decent vocals and entertainment factor. The Bulgarians will always be a bit odd, but they still have decent music since their dÃ©but last year. Maybe they will come into themselves, and give us a hit to send us back to the Slavic region!

Denmark â€“ Simon Mathew

=> Qualifier

There is a lot of Scandinavian chatter about this song, but I find it heinously annoying. Heâ€™s a good singer, decently looking, but the way that the press made it sound is that heâ€™s the most amazing thing since sliced bread, but I like sliced bread better. The singing is good, but I feel like itâ€™s strained and although his outfit is cute, it just doesnâ€™t garner me to want to vote for the always sexy Danesâ€¦

Georgia â€“ Diana Gurtskaya

=> Qualifier

Good message with the song, but I donâ€™t see what anyone else sees. There isnâ€™t anything special about this song, nor the performance, but alas it goes on to the final. Some things I will never understand.

Hungary â€“ CsÃ©zy

â— Personal Favourite

What a lovely ballad, comparing to the harshness of last yearâ€™s jazz number. I donâ€™t know what Europe didnâ€™t like about it, because Iâ€™m impressed and even think that itâ€™s better than the other ballads that are around! Maybe it was so late in the show that people were uninterested after the long string of boring entries?

Malta â€“ Morena

Malta always has cheesy songs about random topics, but I sometimes wonder if they actually speak English, because their English singing is always really iffy. This song doesnâ€™t feature much, and luckily wasnâ€™t over-promoted, but it still flopped. Floppity-flopp-flopp indeed!

Cyprus â€“ Evdokia Kadi

In all fairness and honesty, I donâ€™t even remember this entry; so it must have been boring, â€™nuff said.

F.Y.R. Macedonia â€“ Tamara, VrÄak and Adrijan

Thank goodness that for the first time in a long time, the monster name of Macedonia wonâ€™t be read at all in the final of the voting results. Itâ€™s just as well, other countries deserve a chance, and this time itâ€™s not yours; come back next time, muy muy we love you!

Portugal â€“ VÃ¢nia Fernandes

=> Qualifier

Who do vulumptuous portugese women exist? For Eurovision of course! I donâ€™t know why this scored so well, because Iâ€™m not fond of it, but I seem not to be mainstream anymore, as I mostly just like my dated dance and schlagger stuff. Leave me alone. But I will say something positive: she manages to hide the fact sheâ€™s so huge quite well; great wardrobe choice, but overdone make-up; eeep!

What a night! A few disappointments, but it was a good show regardless; and now the final is to come in a few nights. The weekend of my graduation, however will I manage to fit everything in?!

This yearâ€™s Eurovision Semi-Final(s) appears to be heating up to be a really fierce competition. Iâ€™ve listened to all the songs, followed the Swedish selection (InfÃ¶r ESC), and formed my own opinions and now for the great evening.

In all fairness, being in Canada and working during the days means that I have to watch a taping of it, which sucks, but also because my ISP is so horrible Iâ€™m 5 days behind itâ€™s tragic. On to the show..!

Montenegro â€“ Stefan FilipoviÄ‡

I gotta say that Iâ€™m not terribly fond of this song, mostly because itâ€™s the first one out of the block and there isnâ€™t anything that makes it stand out from the others. On stage it didnâ€™t look very comfortable, nor did the song really fit. Maybe it was because it was in Montenegrin, but it didnâ€™t have any flare that makes me like songs.

Israel â€“ Boaz

=> Qualifier

As usual, Iâ€™m not fond of Israel, even when they have decent songs. I donâ€™t understand why they keep sending the same sort of stuff and they donâ€™t mix it up. This one in particular was written by Dana International which gives it some star power, but the guyâ€™s voice and the way he holds himself up just sort of scares me. Although Europe liked it, itâ€™s a go home song for me, as Israel usually is.

Estonia â€“ Kreisiraadio

â— Personal Favourite

This is a country that never ceases to amaze and amuse me to itâ€™s ends. The songs are always â€œdifferentâ€ and have something special about this one. This song is something that comes straight off the special bus. Although I find it heinously unattractive and insulting on stage, with creepy voices and basically nude dancers, I really like the song as itâ€™s catchy. If I am walking around saying Leto Svet, then we know weâ€™ve got a good song on our hands. ðŸ˜‰

Moldova â€“ Geta Burlacu

â— Personal Favourite

It turns out that this song and performance is actually good. I didnâ€™t expect it to be, but itâ€™s cute in a special Moldavian way. The teddy bear and the cuteness of everything is so special to me, I just canâ€™t help but give it a gold star.

San Marino â€“ Miodio

There is a huge Italian presence this year, and with San Marino being the closest possible entry that is Italian without being Italian, it works. Iâ€™m not very fond of the singer, but the song is decent. The whole time I kept thinking that he looked a little constipated and struggled with the stylist. In any case, no surprises here that it didnâ€™t do well.

Belgium â€“ Ishtar

â— Personal Favourite

What a lovely little song in gibberish, which seems to be a Belgian specialty. The song is nice and catchy, however am I the only one that notices that the instruments on stage donâ€™t actually match what is on the track? The chubby woman is holding a clarinet, and itâ€™s an oboe on the track. I hope that someone noticed this. Large poke-a-dot dresses are now in, itâ€™s official, and there is nothing sexier than a cellist.

Azerbaijan â€“ Elnur and Samir

=> Qualifier

â— Personal Favourite

This song is so hawt. Maybe itâ€™s because there is an angelic vampire on stage who is actually a dentist, hairstylist, and contra-tenor voice. Itâ€™s hawt as fuck, thatâ€™s all I can say. If anyone actually noticed Elnurâ€™s eyes, they would know what Iâ€™m talking about. The wine pouring is a bitch much, but itâ€™s a greatly entertaining show on stage with some good vocal stuff going on all at the same time. I love this first entry!

Slovenia â€“ Rebeka Dremelj

â— Personal Favourite

What a wonderfully fun song! I thought it would flop and not be good on stage, but really I was really entertaining. I think that the chains were a bit much, but the song had a lot of â€œumphfâ€ that it needs to do well. I was super impressed with itâ€™s shock factor and what it had to bring to the competition. I mean, neon lights.. Common!!

Norway â€“ Maria

=> Qualifier

I hesitate to make this a personal favourite, because itâ€™s borderline. I think that itâ€™s a lot of good in it, and itâ€™s totally worthy of going to the final and doing well, however there is something about it that bothers me. Maybe itâ€™s the Norwegian delegation telling her to cancel everything and be ready for the final, that bothers me so much. itâ€™s a song with everything, though I will admit. Even the cheesy backup dancers doing â€œooohâ€ all the time!

Poland â€“ Isis Gee

=> Qualifier

Well at least Poland didnâ€™t bring a whore this year; just an American who looks like she has the fakest tan ever. Sheâ€™s dripping sweat, wailing out a ballad, in a beautiful dress and pretending that sheâ€™s actually Polish; which she clearly isnâ€™t. Itâ€™s a good song, however I donâ€™t think that it was good choice for Europe at all; and thatâ€™s what bothers me, as it took the space of another song that could have had a birth in the Final.

Ireland â€“ Dustin the Turkey

â— Personal Favourite

This is so tragic but I actually like this song; itâ€™s just catchy and funny. So superflu as the French would say. There are large feathers, and a stuffed Turkey, and lots of dancing around and making fun of other people. I think that itâ€™s fabulosity level is so high that it hurts. Iâ€™m not surprised that the Irish picked it though; as itâ€™s clearly a backlash from sucking so badly last year. Instead of backlash, may I say, one should just form a better songâ€¦

Andorra â€“ Gisela

â— Personal Favourite

CatalÃ¡n schlagger twenty years too late makes me so happy. It should have been something from the 80â€™s, but Gisela rocks it out with massive hair. Why is it so large, I donâ€™t know but itâ€™s awesome. The vocals are a bit sketchy, but the song is just fun fun fun. Why would anyone vote for Andorra anyways? I mean there was a huge controversy this year about the song being in English and not Catalan, but oh well, even with a stir they canâ€™t muster enough voices. So sad.

Bosnia & Herzegovina â€“ Laka

==> Qualifier

A lot of people have tipped this as a favourite, but I find it kind of annoying. I can see why it made it further, but the lead singerâ€™s voice just makes me cringe it is so whiny. The song is fun and different, but heâ€™s so awkward looking and odd singing voice. Iâ€™m not with the masses, here. I am not a big fan.

Armenia â€“ Sirusho

=> Qualifier

â— Personal Favourite

Oh my goodness this is so fabulous. I love it so much, I donâ€™t even know why. I think that it just makes me get up an dance, with Eastern flavour, and it makes it all just better than it really is. The little noises in the mixed background make me happy; however her hair is just a little too much for her to handle, and the song would have been better if she had smaller hair. But the song is just fabulous, and Iâ€™m so glad that it will place top 10 for sure!

Netherlands â€“ Hind

Iâ€™m not surprised that this didnâ€™t go through at all. Itâ€™s a decent song, but it lacks so much. Each year Holland tries to do better and better and they just end up doing worse and worse; maybe if they took things less seriously that might result in something good? The nation has a huge history and tons of experience, but when Hilversum calls, I donâ€™t think things arenâ€™t workinâ€™ so well for them.

Finland â€“ TerÃ¤sbetoni

==> Qualifier

Wow, Finland actually qualified? Why is this? Itâ€™s because itâ€™s hard-rock, and all the boyfriends of the girls that force them to watch the show with them vote for the only song they can relate toâ€¦ plain and simple. This song has nothing else to offer, and is only a poor reflection of hard rock music that Finland offers and loves. When will they have the goths on stage, I can only wait!?

Romania â€“ Nico and Vlad

=> Qualifier

Now if Iâ€™m not mistaken, I donâ€™t really remember this song much at all. I canâ€™t remember anything special about it, nor really what was going on, which means that it wasnâ€™t the most exciting thing on the stage but it works, I suppose. I think it was in a foreign language, but I could be mistaken, at least I thinkâ€¦

Russia â€“ Dima Bilan

=> Qualifier

Him again? This is a straight-up go home song, again. His English singing is horrendous, and there is a pad of ice on the stage with Yvgeni Plushenko (or whatever his name is) skating around.
